comment:
/**
 *  Docma (web) core.
 *
 *  When you build the documentation with a template, `docma-web.js` will be
 *  generated (and linked in the main HTML); which is the core engine for the
 *  documentation web app. This will include everything the app needs such as
 *  the documentation data, compiled partials, dustjs engine, etc...
 *
 *  This object is globally accessible from the generated SPA (Single Page
 *  Application).
 *
 *  Note that the size of this script depends especially on the generated
 *  documentation data.
 *
 *  @type {Object}
 *  @global
 *  @name docma
 */
description:
Docma (web) core.

 When you build the documentation with a template, `docma-web.js` will be
 generated (and linked in the main HTML); which is the core engine for the
 documentation web app. This will include everything the app needs such as
 the documentation data, compiled partials, dustjs engine, etc...

 This object is globally accessible from the generated SPA (Single Page
 Application).

 Note that the size of this script depends especially on the generated
 documentation data.
name: docma

$members.comment:
/**
     *  Adds a new Dust filter.
     *  @chainable
     *  @see {@link ?content=docma-filters|Existing Docma (Dust) filters}
     *  @see {@link http://www.dustjs.com/docs/filter-api|Dust Filter API}
     *
     *  @param {String} name
     *         Name of the filter to be added.
     *  @param {Function} fn
     *         Filter function.
     *
     *  @returns {docma} - `docma` for chaining.
     *
     *  @throws {Error} - If a filter with the given name already exists.
     */
$members.description: Adds a new Dust filter.

params.description: Name of the filter to be added.
params.name: name

params.description: Filter function.
params.name: fn

exceptions.description: - If a filter with the given name already exists.

$members.name: addFilter

$members.comment:
/** * Hash-map of JSDoc documentation outputs. * Each key is the name of an API (formed by grouped Javascript files). * e.g. `docma.apis["some-api"]` * * Unnamed documentation data (consisting of ungrouped Javascript files) can be * accessed via `docma.apis._def_`. * * Each value is an `Object` with the following signature: * `{ documentation:Array, symbols:Array }`. `documentation` is the actual * JSDoc data, and `symbols` is a flat array of symbol names. * * See {@link ?api=docma#Docma~BuildConfiguration|build configuration} for more * details on how Javascript files can be grouped (and named) to form separate * API documentations and SPA routes. * * @name docma.apis * @type {Object} * * @example * // output ungrouped (unnamed) API documentation data * console.log(docma.apis._def_.documentation); * console.log(docma.apis._def_.symbols); // flat list of symbol names * // output one of the grouped (named) API documentation data * console.log(docma.apis['my-scondary-api'].documentation); * * @example * * {#documentation} *

{longname}

*

{description}

*
* {/documentation} */
$members.description:
Hash-map of JSDoc documentation outputs.
	Each key is the name of an API (formed by grouped Javascript files).
	e.g. `docma.apis["some-api"]`

 Unnamed documentation data (consisting of ungrouped Javascript files) can be
 accessed via `docma.apis._def_`.

	Each value is an `Object` with the following signature:
	`{ documentation:Array, symbols:Array }`. `documentation` is the actual
	JSDoc data, and `symbols` is a flat array of symbol names.

 See {@link ?api=docma#Docma~BuildConfiguration|build configuration} for more
 details on how Javascript files can be grouped (and named) to form separate
 API documentations and SPA routes.
$members.name: apis
examples:
{#documentation}

{longname}

{description}

{/documentation}

$members.comment:
/**
 *  Provides configuration data of the generated SPA, which is originally set
 *  at build-time, by the user.
 *  See {@link ?api=docma#Docma~BuildConfiguration|build configuration} for more
 *  details on how these settings take affect.
 *  @name docma.app
 *  @type {Object}
 *
 *  @property {String} title
 *            Document title for the main file of the generated app.
 *            (Value of the `<title/>` tag.)
 *  @property {Array} meta
 *            Array of arbitrary objects set for main document meta (tags).
 *  @property {String} base
 *            Base path of the generated web app.
 *  @property {String} entrance
 *            Name of the initial content displayed, when the web app is first
 *            loaded.
 *  @property {String|Object} routing
 *            Routing settings for the generated SPA.
 *  @property {String} server
 *            Server/host type of the generated SPA.
 */
$members.description:
Provides configuration data of the generated SPA, which is originally set
 at build-time, by the user.
 See {@link ?api=docma#Docma~BuildConfiguration|build configuration} for more
 details on how these settings take affect.
$members.name: app

properties.description: Base path of the generated web app.
properties.name: base

properties.description:
Name of the initial content displayed, when the web app is first
           loaded.
properties.name: entrance

properties.description: Array of arbitrary objects set for main document meta (tags).
properties.name: meta

properties.description: Routing settings for the generated SPA.
properties.name: routing

properties.description: Server/host type of the generated SPA.
properties.name: server

properties.description:
Document title for the main file of the generated app.
           (Value of the `<title/>` tag.)
properties.name: title

$members.comment:
/**
     *  Gets the route information for the current rendered content being
     *  displayed.
     *
     *  @name docma.currentRoute
     *  @type {Route}
     *  @readonly
     *
     *  @property {String} type
     *            Type of the current route. If a generated JSDoc API
     *            documentation is being displayed, this is set to `"api"`.
     *            If any other HTML content (such as a converted markdown) is
     *            being displayed; this is set to `"content"`.
     *  @property {String} name
     *            Name of the current route. For `api` routes, this is the name
     *            of the grouped JS files parsed. If no name is given, this is
     *            set to `"_def_"` by default. For `content` routes, this is
     *            either the custom name given at build-time or, by default; the
     *            name of the generated HTML file; lower-cased, without the
     *            extension. e.g. `"README.md"` will have the route name
     *            `"readme"` after the build.
     *  @property {String} path
     *            Path of the current route.
     */
$members.description:
Gets the route information for the current rendered content being
 displayed.
$members.name: currentRoute

properties.description:
Name of the current route. For `api` routes, this is the name
           of the grouped JS files parsed. If no name is given, this is
           set to `"_def_"` by default. For `content` routes, this is
           either the custom name given at build-time or, by default; the
           name of the generated HTML file; lower-cased, without the
           extension. e.g. `"README.md"` will have the route name
           `"readme"` after the build.
properties.name: name

properties.description: Path of the current route.
properties.name: path

properties.description:
Type of the current route. If a generated JSDoc API
           documentation is being displayed, this is set to `"api"`.
           If any other HTML content (such as a converted markdown) is
           being displayed; this is set to `"content"`.
properties.name: type

$members.comment:
/** * JSDoc documentation data for the current API route. * If current route is not an API route, this will be `null`. * * See {@link ?api=docma#Docma~BuildConfiguration|build configuration} for more * details on how Javascript files can be grouped (and named) to form * separate API documentations and SPA routes. * * @name docma.documentation * @type {Array} * * @example * // output current API documentation data * if (docma.currentRoute.type === 'api') { * console.log(docma.documentation); * } * * @example * * {#documentation} *

{longname}

*

{description}

*
* {/documentation} */
$members.description:
JSDoc documentation data for the current API route.
	If current route is not an API route, this will be `null`.

 See {@link ?api=docma#Docma~BuildConfiguration|build configuration} for more
 details on how Javascript files can be grouped (and named) to form
 separate API documentations and SPA routes.
$members.name: documentation

$members.comment:
/**
     *  Asynchronously fetches (text) content from the given URL via an
     *  `XmlHttpRequest`. Note that the URL has to be in the same-origin, for
     *  this to work.
     *
     *  @param {String} url
     *         URL to be fetched.
     *  @param {Function} callback
     *         Function to be executed when the content is fetched; with the
     *         following signature: `function (status, responseText) { .. }`
     */
$members.description:
Asynchronously fetches (text) content from the given URL via an
 `XmlHttpRequest`. Note that the URL has to be in the same-origin, for
 this to work.

params.description: URL to be fetched.
params.name: url

params.description:
Function to be executed when the content is fetched; with the
        following signature: `function (status, responseText) { .. }`
params.name: callback

$members.name: fetch

$members.comment:
/**
     *  Similar to `window.location` but with differences and additional
     *  information.
     *
     *  @name docma.location
     *  @type {Object}
     *  @readonly
     *
     *  @property {String} origin
     *            Gets the protocol, hostname and port number of the current URL.
     *  @property {String} host
     *            Gets the hostname and port number of the current URL.
     *  @property {String} hostname
     *            Gets the domain name of the web host.
     *  @property {String} protocol
     *            Gets the web protocol used, without `:` suffix.
     *  @property {String} href
     *            Gets the href (URL) of the current location.
     *  @property {String} entrance
     *            Gets the application entrance route, which is set at Docma build-time.
     *  @property {String} base
     *            Gets the base path of the application URL, which is set at Docma build-time.
     *  @property {String} fullpath
     *            Gets the path and filename of the current URL.
     *  @property {String} pathname
     *            Gets the path and filename of the current URL, without the base.
     *  @property {String} path
     *            Gets the path, filename and query-string of the current URL, without the base.
     *  @property {String} hash
     *            Gets the anchor `#` of the current URL, without `#` prefix.
     *  @property {String} query
     *            Gets the querystring part of the current URL, without `?` prefix.
     *  @property {Function} getQuery()
     *            Gets the value of the given querystring parameter.
     */
$members.description:
Similar to `window.location` but with differences and additional
 information.
$members.name: location

properties.description: Gets the base path of the application URL, which is set at Docma build-time.
properties.name: base

properties.description: Gets the application entrance route, which is set at Docma build-time.

properties.name: fullpath

properties.description: Gets the value of the given querystring parameter.

properties.description: Gets the anchor `#` of the current URL, without `#` prefix.
properties.name: hash

properties.description: Gets the hostname and port number of the current URL.
properties.name: host

properties.description: Gets the domain name of the web host.
properties.name: hostname

properties.description: Gets the href (URL) of the current location.
properties.name: href

properties.description: Gets the protocol, hostname and port number of the current URL.
properties.name: origin

properties.description: Gets the path, filename and query-string of the current URL, without the base.
properties.name: path

properties.description: Gets the path and filename of the current URL, without the base.
properties.name: pathname

properties.description: Gets the web protocol used, without `:` suffix.
properties.name: protocol

properties.description: Gets the querystring part of the current URL, without `?` prefix.

/**
     *  Removes the given listener from the specified event.

     *  @chainable
     *
     *  @param {String} eventName
     *         Name of the event to remove the listener from.
     *         See {@link #docma.Event|`docma.Event`} enumeration.
     *  @param {Function} listener
     *         Function to be removed from the event.
     *
     *  @returns {docma} - `docma` for chaining.
     */
$members.description: Removes the given listener from the specified event.

params.description:
Name of the event to remove the listener from.
        See {@link #docma.Event|`docma.Event`} enumeration.
params.name: eventName

params.description: Function to be removed from the event.
params.name: listener

$members.name: removeListener

$members.description:
Adds a listener function to the specified event.
 Note that the listener will not be added if it is a duplicate.
 If the listener returns true then it will be removed after it is called.

params.description:
Name of the event to attach the listener to.
        See {@link #docma.Event|`docma.Event`} enumeration.
params.name: eventName

params.description:
Function to be called when the event is emitted. If the function
        returns true then it will be removed after calling.
params.name: listener

$members.name: addListener

$members.comment:
/**
     *  Adds a listener that will be automatically removed after its first
     *  execution.
     *  @alias docma.addOnceListener
     *  @chainable
     *
     *  @param {String} eventName
     *         Name of the event to attach the listener to.
     *         See {@link #docma.Event|`docma.Event`} enumeration.
     *  @param {Function} listener
     *         Function to be called when the event is emitted.
     *
     *  @returns {docma} - `docma` for chaining.
     *
     *  @example
     *  docma.once('ready', function () {
     *  	console.log('Docma is ready!');
     *  });
     */
$members.description:
Adds a listener that will be automatically removed after its first
 execution.

Name of the event to attach the listener to.
        See {@link #docma.Event|`docma.Event`} enumeration.

$members.comment:
/**
     *  Renders content into docma-main element, by the given route information.
     *
     *  If the content is empty or `"api"`, we'll render the `docma-api`
     *  Dust template. Otherwise, (e.g. `"readme"`) we'll render `docma-content`
     *  Dust template, then  fetch `content/readme.html` and load it in the
     *  `docma-main` element.
     *
     *  Note that rendering and the callback will be cancelled if the given
     *  content is the latest content rendered.
     *
     *  @param {Route} routeInfo
     *         Route information of the page to be rendered.
     *  @param {Function} [callback]
     *         Function to be executed when the rendering is complete.
     *         `function (httpStatus:Number) { .. }`
     *
     *  @emits docma.Event.Render
     */
$members.description:
Renders content into docma-main element, by the given route information.

 If the content is empty or `"api"`, we'll render the `docma-api`
 Dust template. Otherwise, (e.g. `"readme"`) we'll render `docma-content`
 Dust template, then  fetch `content/readme.html` and load it in the
 `docma-main` element.

 Note that rendering and the callback will be cancelled if the given
 content is the latest content rendered.

params.description: Route information of the page to be rendered.
params.name: routeInfo

params.description:
Function to be executed when the rendering is complete.
        `function (httpStatus:Number) { .. }`
params.name: callback

$members.name: render

$members.comment:
/**
     *  Docma SPA route types enumeration.
     *  @memberof docma
     *  @enum {String}
     *  @readonly
     *
     *  @example
     *  // docma.app.routing.method = "query"
     *  type     name              path
     *  -------  ----------------  --------------------------
     *  api      _def_             /?api
     *  api      docma-web         /?api=docma-web
     *  content  templates         /?content=templates
     *  content  guide             /?content=guide
     *
     *  @example
     *  // docma.app.routing.method = "path"
     *  type     name              path
     *  -------  ----------------  --------------------------
     *  api      _def_             /api
     *  api      docma-web         /api/docma-web
     *  content  templates         /templates
     *  content  guide             /guide
     *
     */
$members.description: Docma SPA route types enumeration.
examples:
// docma.app.routing.method = "query"
 type     name              path
 -------  ----------------  --------------------------
 api      _def_             /?api
 api      docma-web         /?api=docma-web
 content  templates         /?content=templates
 content  guide             /?content=guide

// docma.app.routing.method = "path"
 type     name              path
 -------  ----------------  --------------------------
 api      _def_             /api
 api      docma-web         /api/docma-web
 content  templates         /templates
 content  guide             /guide
$members.name: Route.Type

properties.description: Indicates that the route is for API documentation content.
properties.name: API

properties.description:
Indicates that the route is for other content, such as HTML files
 generated from markdown.
properties.name: CONTENT

$members.name: routes

*
{template.name} by {template.author}
*/

Provides template specific configuration data.
 This is also useful within the Dust partials of the Docma template.
